plugins.name: Auto Layout Checker
plugins.description:
Auto Layout Checker helps you maintain design consistency by identifying and converting elements that don't use Auto Layout. Perfect for cleaning up designs and ensuring layout consistency across your files.


üîç Key Features:

‚Ä¢ Scan entire pages or selected elements for missing Auto Layout

‚Ä¢ One-click conversion of frames and groups to Auto Layout

‚Ä¢ Clear visual feedback for converted elements

‚Ä¢ Theme-aware interface that matches your Figma theme

‚Ä¢ Quick navigation to elements through direct selection


üéØ Perfect for:

‚Ä¢ Design system cleanup and maintenance

‚Ä¢ Legacy file modernization

‚Ä¢ Team collaboration and consistency checks

‚Ä¢ Quick Auto Layout implementation


üí° How to use:

1. Select elements to scan (or leave unselected to scan entire page)

2. Click "Scan" to find elements without Auto Layout

3. Click any element to navigate to it in your design

4. Use the "Convert" button to instantly apply Auto Layout


The plugin automatically applies sensible Auto Layout defaults:

‚Ä¢ Vertical layout orientation

‚Ä¢ 10px spacing between elements

‚Ä¢ 10px padding on all sides

‚Ä¢ Automatic sizing for both axes


Keep your designs maintainable and responsive with Auto Layout Checker!
plugins.tagline: Quickly find and convert elements missing Auto Layout, streamlining your design system consistency.

plugins.name: Pager
plugins.description:
Design-Ready File Templates in Seconds

Stop rebuilding your file structure every time.

Pager helps you spin up clean, structured Figma files with reusable templates built from your own component libraries or ours.


Whether you're starting a new product flow, setting up for research, or handing off to devs, Pager gives you a smart starting point so you can focus on design, not setup.

plugins.name: Refine Selection
plugins.description:
Refine Selection: Smart Layer Filtering for Figma


Transform your selection workflow with this powerful tool that helps you select and deselect layers with precision. Perfect for designers who work with complex designs and need quick access to specific layer types.


Key Features:

‚Ä¢ One-Click Selection: Instantly select all layers of a specific type within your current selection

‚Ä¢ Alt+Click to Deselect: Hold Alt (or Option) to deselect layers instead of selecting them

‚Ä¢ Smart Layer Detection: Automatically identifies and filters:

- Text layers

- All shapes

- Primitives (stars, polygons, lines, rectangles, ellipses)

- Paths

- Lines

- Image layers

- Frame layers


Workflow Benefits:

‚Ä¢ Save Time: No more manual selection of multiple layers

‚Ä¢ Reduce Errors: Precise selection of specific layer types

‚Ä¢ Smart UI: Buttons automatically disable when no matching layers are found

‚Ä¢ Intuitive Design: Clean interface with visual feedback


Perfect For:

Designers working with complex layouts

Teams managing large design systems

Anyone who needs to quickly select specific layer types

Designers who frequently work with nested components


üí° Pro Tip: Hold Alt (or Option) while clicking to deselect layers instead of selecting them!


Note: Free version includes rate limiting of 50 selection per minute. Subscribe to remove limitations and support future development.
plugins.tagline: Refine Selection: Smart Layer Filtering for Figma

plugins.name: Version Linker
plugins.description:
Version Linker - Link and Manage Component Versions


A powerful version management plugin for Figma that helps you link and track different versions of your components across frames.


Key Features:

‚Ä¢ Create Main Version Links (MVL) to establish version control points

‚Ä¢ Add Secondary Version Links (SVL) to connect related components

‚Ä¢ Navigate instantly between linked components

‚Ä¢ Add descriptions to track changes and updates

‚Ä¢ Customize version colors for better visual organization

‚Ä¢ Manage versions with easy-to-use edit and delete functions


Perfect for:

‚Ä¢ Design systems with multiple component versions

‚Ä¢ Teams tracking component evolution

‚Ä¢ Projects requiring version history

‚Ä¢ Maintaining component relationships across frames


How it works:

1. Create an MVL with a version number and color

2. Add SVLs to connect related components in different frames

3. Add descriptions to document changes

4. Use the navigation buttons to quickly move between linked components


Stay organized and maintain clear version relationships in your Figma files with Version Linker.

plugins.name: Auto Layout Remover
plugins.description:
Auto Layout Remover helps you quickly clean up messy Figma files and make them easier to edit or prototype.


When to use it:

  1. You want to redesign freely. If your design is full of auto layouts and deeply nested frames, and you just want to move things around without dealing with layout constraints ‚Äî this plugin flattens everything so you can edit with ease.
  2. You‚Äôre building an interactive prototype. Auto layouts often create layers and nesting that block or overlap each other. This plugin helps you clean the structure fast ‚Äî so you can bring the right blocks to the top and avoid layout issues.


What it does:

  1. Turns off all auto layouts, keeping objects in place
  2. Ungroups frames and groups without visible styles (no fill, no stroke, or hidden)
  3. Deletes hidden layers and empty frames
  4. Leaves instances and styled frames untouched
  5. Makes your file flat, clean, and easy to work with
plugins.tagline: Remove all auto layouts, empty frames, and groups in one click.

plugins.description:
üîç Find lost local automatically catches every local instance whose master component lives in another library / document.

Just set a prefix symbol (default ‚Äú_‚Äù) and choose the search scope‚Äîcurrent page or whole file.


Features

‚Ä¢Any nesting depth ‚Äì detects instances hidden inside local components and their masters.

‚Ä¢Page-level grouping ‚Äì shows how many problematic components each page contains.

‚Ä¢One-click jump ‚Äì selects and zooms to the target instance.

‚Ä¢Custom prefix ‚Äì works with _Tabs, .hidden, -draft, @deprecated, or any symbol you use for local components.


When it helps

‚Ä¢Before publishing a library ‚Äì make sure no stray local copies remain in the file.

‚Ä¢During a design-system migration ‚Äì quickly spot legacy components that still point elsewhere.

‚Ä¢While reviewing external files ‚Äì instantly see what is pulled from external libraries.


How to use

1.Open the plugin and, if needed, change the prefix symbol.

2.Pick Current page or Whole file and click Search.

3.Review the grouped list. Clicking a component name jumps to its first found instance.

4.Items labelled ‚ÄúOutside pages‚Äù exist only inside master components; fix them in the corresponding library.


The plugin works entirely inside Figma‚Äîno internet access required, and no data ever leaves your account.

133089.name: Find lost local ‚Äî ¬´–ù–∞–π—Ç–∏ –ø–æ—Ç–µ—Ä—è–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –ª–æ–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –∫–æ–º–ø–æ–Ω–µ–Ω—Ç—ã¬ª
133089.description:
üîç Find lost local automatically catches every local instance whose master component lives in another library / document.

Just set a prefix symbol (default ‚Äú_‚Äù) and choose the search scope‚Äîcurrent page or whole file.


Features

‚Ä¢Any nesting depth ‚Äì detects instances hidden inside local components and their masters.

‚Ä¢Page-level grouping ‚Äì shows how many problematic components each page contains.

‚Ä¢One-click jump ‚Äì selects and zooms to the target instance.

‚Ä¢Custom prefix ‚Äì works with _Tabs, .hidden, -draft, @deprecated, or any symbol you use for local components.


When it helps

‚Ä¢Before publishing a library ‚Äì make sure no stray local copies remain in the file.

‚Ä¢During a design-system migration ‚Äì quickly spot legacy components that still point elsewhere.

‚Ä¢While reviewing external files ‚Äì instantly see what is pulled from external libraries.


How to use

1.Open the plugin and, if needed, change the prefix symbol.

2.Pick Current page or Whole file and click Search.

3.Review the grouped list. Clicking a component name jumps to its first found instance.

4.Items labelled ‚ÄúOutside pages‚Äù exist only inside master components; fix them in the corresponding library.


The plugin works entirely inside Figma‚Äîno internet access required, and no data ever leaves your account.

## Ê≥®ÊÑè‰∫ãÈ†Ö

- „Åì„ÅÆ„Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„ÅØÈÅ∏ÊäûÁîªÂÉè„ÅÆÂÜÖÂÆπ„ÇíÂ§ñÈÉ®AI„Çµ„Éº„Éì„ÇπÔºàGoogle Gemini/OpenAIÔºâ„Å´ÈÄÅ‰ø°„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Éó„É©„Ç§„Éê„Ç∑„Éº„ÇÑÊ©üÂØÜÊÉÖÂ†±„ÅÆÂèñ„ÇäÊâ±„ÅÑ„Å´„ÅîÊ≥®ÊÑè„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ„ÄÇ

- ÁîüÊàê„Åï„Çå„Çãalt„ÉÜ„Ç≠„Çπ„Éà„ÅØAI„Å´„Çà„ÇãËá™ÂãïÁîüÊàê„ÅÆ„Åü„ÇÅ„ÄÅÊúÄÁµÇÁöÑ„Å™ÂÜÖÂÆπ„ÅØ„ÅîËá™Ë∫´„Åß„ÅîÁ¢∫Ë™ç„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ„ÄÇ


---


## English


### Overview

AI Alt Text Generator is a Figma plugin that uses Google Gemini or OpenAI Vision APIs to automatically generate accessible alt text for selected images in your Figma file.


### Features

- Generate alt text using **Gemini (Google) or OpenAI Vision API**

- **UI and prompt language switch (Japanese/English)** with a single button

- **API keys are securely saved** using Figma's clientStorage

- **Generate multiple candidates (1‚Äì5) at once, editable and selectable**

- **Keyword input** to influence the generated alt text

- **Image preview** and status display

- **Clear error feedback**


### Setup

1. Install the plugin in Figma

2. Obtain a [Google Gemini API key](https://aistudio.google.com/apikey) or an [OpenAI API key](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys)

3. Launch the plugin and enter/save your API key(s) in the Settings tab


### How to Use

1. **Select an image node on the Figma canvas**

2. In the "Generate Alt Text" tab, click the "Analyze Image" button

3. The image preview and size will be displayed

4. Optionally, enter keywords (comma-separated for English, "„ÄÅ" for Japanese) and select the number of candidates

5. Click the "Generate Alt Text" button

6. Candidate alt texts will be displayed, each editable

7. Copy the desired alt text and paste it into Figma's alt text field or elsewhere as needed


### Language Switch

- Use the "Êó•Êú¨Ë™û | English" button at the top right to instantly switch all UI and prompts between Japanese and English


### About API Keys

- Either Gemini or OpenAI API key is required (if both are entered, Gemini is prioritized)

- API keys are securely saved in Figma's clientStorage

- Please check each service's official documentation for free tier and usage limits


### Notes

- This plugin sends the selected image to external AI services (Google Gemini/OpenAI) for analysis. Please be mindful of privacy and confidential information.

- The generated alt text is AI-generated; please review and edit as needed before use.

- „Åì„ÅÆ„Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„ÅØÈÅ∏ÊäûÁîªÂÉè„ÅÆÂÜÖÂÆπ„ÇíÂ§ñÈÉ®AI„Çµ„Éº„Éì„ÇπÔºàGoogle Gemini/OpenAIÔºâ„Å´ÈÄÅ‰ø°„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Éó„É©„Ç§„Éê„Ç∑„Éº„ÇÑÊ©üÂØÜÊÉÖÂ†±„ÅÆÂèñ„ÇäÊâ±„ÅÑ„Å´„ÅîÊ≥®ÊÑè„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ„ÄÇ

- ÁîüÊàê„Åï„Çå„Çãalt„ÉÜ„Ç≠„Çπ„Éà„ÅØAI„Å´„Çà„ÇãËá™ÂãïÁîüÊàê„ÅÆ„Åü„ÇÅ„ÄÅÊúÄÁµÇÁöÑ„Å™ÂÜÖÂÆπ„ÅØ„ÅîËá™Ë∫´„Åß„ÅîÁ¢∫Ë™ç„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ„ÄÇ

## English


### Overview

AI Alt Text Generator is a Figma plugin that uses Google Gemini or OpenAI Vision APIs to automatically generate accessible alt text for selected images in your Figma file.


### Features

- Generate alt text using **Gemini (Google) or OpenAI Vision API**

- **UI and prompt language switch (Japanese/English)** with a single button

- **API keys are securely saved** using Figma's clientStorage

- **Generate multiple candidates (1‚Äì5) at once, editable and selectable**

- **Keyword input** to influence the generated alt text

- **Image preview** and status display

- **Clear error feedback**


### Setup

1. Install the plugin in Figma

2. Obtain a [Google Gemini API key](https://aistudio.google.com/apikey) or an [OpenAI API key](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys)

3. Launch the plugin and enter/save your API key(s) in the Settings tab


### How to Use

1. **Select an image node on the Figma canvas**

2. In the "Generate Alt Text" tab, click the "Analyze Image" button

3. The image preview and size will be displayed

4. Optionally, enter keywords (comma-separated for English, "„ÄÅ" for Japanese) and select the number of candidates

5. Click the "Generate Alt Text" button

6. Candidate alt texts will be displayed, each editable

7. Copy the desired alt text and paste it into Figma's alt text field or elsewhere as needed


### Language Switch

- Use the "Êó•Êú¨Ë™û | English" button at the top right to instantly switch all UI and prompts between Japanese and English


### About API Keys

- Either Gemini or OpenAI API key is required (if both are entered, Gemini is prioritized)

- API keys are securely saved in Figma's clientStorage

- Please check each service's official documentation for free tier and usage limits


### Notes

- This plugin sends the selected image to external AI services (Google Gemini/OpenAI) for analysis. Please be mindful of privacy and confidential information.

- The generated alt text is AI-generated; please review and edit as needed before use.

plugins.name: EasySpotlight
plugins.description: EasySpotlight makes it simple to highlight key areas you want to focus on. Just turn your original image into a frame, add a new frame over the area you want to spotlight, select two frames, and click the "Create Spotlight" button. The plugin will dim the background and create a custom highlight‚Äîperfect for presentations, tutorials, or showcasing design details!

plugins.name: Add Section
plugins.description:
Add a section around your selected elements with a padding

  1. Select elements (frames, rectangles, even other sections)
  2. Set your desired padding (horizontal, vertical)
  3. Click Add section to put a new section around your selected elements


Resize existing sections to have the correct padding

  1. Select one or more sections
  2. Set your desired padding (horizontal, vertical)
  3. Click Resize Sections to adjust all selected sections
plugins.tagline: Add a section around your selected elements with a padding

plugins.name: Quick Navigator
plugins.description:
Quick Navigator is a lightweight yet powerful plugin designed to help you stay oriented while working on large or complex Figma files. Instead of endlessly zooming and panning around, this plugin gives you a miniature view of your entire canvas thus making it easier than ever to find what you're looking for.


Features:

  1. See all your frames and sections in a simplified, scrollable mini window.
  2. Tap on any visible frame or section in the mini view to instantly select and focus it on the main canvas.
  3. Ideal when you're moving fast, experimenting, or managing chaotic canvases, no need for everything to be clean or structured.


NOTE: Currently, SVG shapes and text layers are not included in the mini view.
plugins.tagline: Never get lost on the canvas again!
